basics.name: Stanislava Gardasevic
basics.label: PhD Candidate
basics.summary: I am a PhD candidate at Communication and Information Sciences Interdisciplinary Program at University of Hawaii at Manoa. My research is related to visualization of networks of people and resources (knowledge graphs) in my academic program. I am utilizing many methodologies to design those visualizations, espeicially participatory design.

area: Communication and Information Sciences (CIS) Interdisciplinary Program

education.institution: University College Oslo (Norway), University of Tallinn (Estonia), University of Parma (Italy)
education.area: International Master in Digital Library Learning

work.summary: I am an instructor of record for four graduate level courses at Library and Information Sciences Program
highlights: Technology for Library and Information Centres

work.summary: Involved in the development of multiple e-services (digital libraries, digital archive, web archive, national metadata aggregator). Engaged in multiple international projects, communication, and collaborations.
highlights: Europeana 1914-1918 Project - digitization of WW1 material

volunteer.summary: We are conducting qualitative research by following human-centered design processes to inform the design of a new volunteers’ management system. I am involved in interviewing SIGCHI/ACM community members, transcribing, interview coding, and writing the report.

awards.title: Full Scholarship to attend Master Studies
awards.summary: One of 18 recipients of Erasmus Mundus Full Scholarship for attending two year long Digital library learning master program in Norway, Estonia, an Italy

awards.title: IFLA/OCLC Fellowship
awards.summary: I was one of the five new professionals from developing countries that was awarded a fellowship to stay for one month in OCLC headqourters and visit numerous libraries across USA, Library of Congress including.
